revised_title: Experimental Research on the Etiology of Endemic Goitre
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to determine the cause of endemic goitre, a thyroid gland enlargement, and found that it is due to a living organism present in goitre-producing water. They also discovered that intestinal parasites, specifically amoebic infection, were common in goitrous individuals, but it is unclear if they are related to the disease. The research was conducted in Gilgit, Kashmir.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Human Physiology
